subject: Payment of legal charges
text: HTrrf <cftv <ToTHTf wfadrrut Phone 91-11-25074100/2574200 (ago 4arn 3ir <aurff +AT) Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 577 Extn. 2223/2318/2468/2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/21/2002-Admn.-III March; 2004 POLICYMATTERS-ADMINSTRATIONFINANCE (76/2004 (Decision taken on DM Division File No. NHAI/19011/1/97-PILA) Sub: Payment of Legal Charges Kindly refer to Policy Circular (50/2003) of even number dated June 30, 2003 vide which the procedure for engagement of legal firmsladvocates was prescribed. Various queries received in this regard have been examined and it has been decided to issue consolidated guidelines covering all the procedure for engagement of legal  fims and payment of fees thereof as under: (i) Project Directors may engage advocates/law firms with atleast 10 years of experience in the relevant field for dealing with the cases of routine nature such a5 land acquisition etc While doing SO, Project Directors should rotate the cases among a few advocates instead f 'entrusting cases to only one. (ii)  Payment may be made by the PIUs to the legal firsladvocates for defending the legal cases Or for  obtaining legal   opinion/advise, as per the schedule of rates prescribed as per annexure. There is no need to make any reference to HQs in this regard, (iii) Where any legal action is proposed to be initiated, prior approval of the Competent Authority must be obtained for such action. Once the action is approved by the Competent Authority the payments thereafter may be made by the PIUs a8 per the guidelines prescribed at (ii) above (iv) At headquarters, the concerned division may engage law firms having atleast 10 years experience in dealing with similar cases of Central/State Govt: organizations/PSUs. (v) In case Divisional Heads/Project Directors feel that there is a need  for engaging senior counsel/law fir at a rate   higher   than what has been   prescribed in the schedule,   prior   approval of the Competent Authority   specifying the amount payablelterms of payment must be obtained. (vi) Wherever the payments are to be made in excess of the scheduled rates, approval of the Competent Authority (HQ) for payment of such fee shall be obtained in each case. (vii)At HQ before putting up payment proposals, it should be ensured by the concerned division that sanction of Competent Authority is taken for payment in excess of what is mentioned in the schedule.
